alert.note: Alert for Hardy (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 4:33PM EDT until September 08 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL SHENANDOAH...SOUTHWESTERN FREDERICK COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA AND EASTERN HARDY COUNTIES IN EASTERN WEST VIRGINIA... At 433 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Star Tannery, or 7 miles west of Strasburg, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Shenandoah, southwestern Frederick Counties in northwestern Virginia and eastern Hardy Counties in eastern West Virginia. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
